description: Representative Scott Fitzgerald (R-WI) weighs in on the Netflix-Warner Bros. deal and states he is cautiously optimistic about it and suggests waiting before talking about holding hearings on the transaction. He also talks about Congress' health care fight as the deadline is quickly approaching and what he is hearing about Speaker Johnson potentially placing a Republican proposal on the table before the end of next week. Rep. Fitzgerald speaks with Joe Mathieu and Amara Omeokwe on the late edition of Bloomberg's "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Cautiously Optimistic: Rep. Fitzgerald on Netflix-Warner Bros. Deal

author: Liam Knox
description: The Trump administration has ordered more than 260 federal workers it has been trying to fire since March to return to work on Dec. 15 while a court case over their final status drags on.
title: Trump Education Department Calls Back 260 Staff It Tried to Fire

author: Greg Giroux
description: Gerrymandering is almost as old as the US republic itself. It’s the process of drawing electoral district lines in sometimes absurd ways to fortify one political party at the expense of another. Good-government groups say that gerrymandering lets politicians choose their constituents, rather than the other way around.
title: How Redistricting Keeps Changing the US Political Map

author: Richard Bravo
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen kept up the pressure on Belgium Friday to accede to an EU plan to use Russian central bank assets frozen in Belgium to fund Ukraine.
title: Merz Lobbies Belgium to Back EU’s Jumbo Loan Plan for Ukraine

author: Erik Larson
description: President Donald Trump is fighting to end automatic citizenship for children born to parents who are in the country unlawfully or on temporary visas, part of his broader crackdown on undocumented immigrants and a change that could overturn more than a century of legal precedent.
title: Can Trump Really End Birthright Citizenship?

author: Ott Ummelas
description: Norway’s lawmakers approved the budget for 2026 in line with a deal struck earlier this week, capping a week of drama for Premier Jonas Gahr Store and his Labor Party.
title: Norway Parliament Passes Budget After Labor Deal With Allies

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Joe Sobczyk
description: The president has tried to brush off affordability as an issue.
title: Trump Takes to Campaigning for His Economic Agenda as Polls Sag

description: On today's episode of Bloomberg Businessweek Daily, Scarlet Fu and Alexis Christoforous discuss Netflix agreeing to buy Warner Bros. Discovery in a $72 billion cash and stock deal. Bloomberg's Felix Gillette joins the show to break it down. Also on today's show, LinkedIn Chief Economist Karin Kimbrough on the state of the US labor market, and London Business School's Rebecca Homkes talks fears of an AI bubble and consumer pathways diverging in a K-shaped economy. Plus, Bloomberg Tech Co-Host Ed Ludlow weighs in on a report that SpaceX is planning for a late 2026 IPO. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Netflix to Buy Warner Bros. in Hollywood Blockbuster | Bloomberg Businessweek Daily 12/5/2025

author: Jen Judson
description: Northrop Grumman Corp. reported a successful test-fire of its new solid rocket motor that was built in less than a year, reflecting the industry’s urgency to meet the Trump administration’s demand for homegrown next-generation defense systems.
title: Northrop Races to Test Rocket Motor to Help Replenish US Stocks

author: Matthew Boesler
description: Spending in the US by foreign students fell in the 12 months through September by the most on record, excluding the pandemic, according to monthly figures published Friday by the Bureau of Economic Analysis.
title: Foreign Student Spending in US Is Plunging on Visa Crackdown

author: Alicia A. Caldwell
description: The Trump administration will start charging a $5,000 fee to people apprehended who entered the US illegally.
title: US Border Patrol Plans $5,000 Arrest Fee for Illegal Crossers

description: Rebecca Homkes, member of the faculty at London Business School, says that the idea of an AI bubble isn't black and white, there's 'shades of gray' as the market tries to assess tech earnings. Homkes also spoke to the K-shaped economy, saying that companies need to really think about who their ideal consumer is and stop trying to appeal to a broad base.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Valuations, Talent War & Circular Finance Fuel AI Bubble Fears

description: On the early edition of Balance of Power, Bloomberg Washington Correspondent Joe Mathieu discusses the latest from Capitol Hill. On today's show, Republican Congresswoman Lisa McClain of Michigan, Stonecourt Capital Partner Rick Davis, Podium Strategies Founder Yemisi Egbewole and former Republican Congressman Patrick McHenry. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: House GOP Set to Unveil Healthcare Plan | Balance of Power: Early Edition 12/5/2025

description:
US consumer sentiment rose for the first time in five months, bolstered by a more optimistic outlook for personal finances, though consumers remain troubled by a stubbornly high cost of living, which has been a major drag on sentiment this year. However, LinkedIn Chief Economist Karin Kimbrough believes that despite the bolstered measure of confidence among the consumer, there is widespread insecurity among workers, with confidence in getting or finding a job at the lowest levels the platform has ever seen.
She joined Scarlet Fu and Alexis Christoforous on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to break down the US labor market, and LinkedIn's user trends, hiring, and demand. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Worker Confidence 'Lowest They've Ever Seen,' Says LinkedIn's Chief Economist

description: Former Republican representative from North Carolina Patrick McHenry says that President Trump does not see birthright citizenship as 'settled law' and believes he has the authority to change it, as the Supreme Court says it will review the case. McHenry also weighs in on the health care fight in congress and says he does not believe that lawmakers will be able to come up with a new system before the January 30th deadline.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Supreme Court to Review Trump's Birthright Citizenship Rollback

description: Netflix Inc. agreed to buy Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. in a deal valuing the business at $82.7 billion including debt, with the company spinning off cable networks such as CNN and TNT into a separate company before concluding the sale. The acquisition is expected to close in the next 18 months and will give Netflix ownership of the HBO network, along with its library of hit shows and Warner Bros. assets, including its film and TV archive. Bloomberg's Felix Gillette joined Scarlet Fu and Alexis Christoforous on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to break down the historic deal. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Netflix to Buy Warner Bros. in $72B Cash, Stock Deal

description: Michigan Republican Representative Lisa McClain said any plan to address the cost of insurance under Obamacare will have to deal with both the affordability of premiums and the waste, fraud and abuse in the system (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Health Care Fight Drags On in Congress, As GOP Looks to Overhaul ACA

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court said it will review President Donald Trump’s planned rollback of automatic birthright citizenship, setting up a high-stakes showdown over what long has been understood to be a constitutional right.
title: Supreme Court to Review Trump’s Birthright Citizenship Rollback

author: Zoe Tillman
description: The Virginia man accused of planting pipe bombs in Washington the day before Congress was set to certify the 2020 election results spoke with law enforcement authorities for about four hours after his arrest this week, according to the government.
title: DC Pipe Bomb Suspect Spoke to Authorities for Hours After Arrest

author: Will Wade
description: Constellation Energy Corp. reached a settlement with the US Justice Department, completing the final regulatory hurdle needed to close its $16.4 billion purchase of Calpine Corp. and create America’s biggest fleet of power plants.
title: Constellation Settles With US on $16.4 Billion Calpine Deal

author: Emily Graffeo
description: US Senator Elizabeth Warren is urging regulators to scrutinize the burgeoning private credit market, warning that implosions of Tricolor Holdings and First Brands Group are “likely the tip of the iceberg” in terms of bad debt held by Wall Street’s biggest banks.
title: Warren Demands Private Credit Stress Test After Big Bankruptcies

author: Daniel Carvalho, Vinicius Andrade
description: Brazilian lawmaker Flavio Bolsonaro said his father, former leader Jair Bolsonaro, has backed him to run in the country’s 2026 presidential election, dashing the hopes of investors who had another candidate in mind to unseat President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva.
title: Flavio Bolsonaro Says Father Backs His 2026 Presidential Run

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump praised cooperation between the US, Canada and Mexico at Friday’s World Cup draw, even as divisions over North American trade and immigration policy threaten to overshadow next year’s global soccer tournament hosted by the three neighboring countries.
title: Trump Hails Mexico, Canada Cooperation at World Cup Draw

author: Katy O'Donnell
description: Senate Democrats are pressing their Republican colleagues to summon the Trump administration’s top housing regulator to Capitol Hill for questioning about his turbulent tenure overseeing the nation’s $13 trillion mortgage market.
title: Senate Democrats Want Housing Chief Pulte to Testify by January

author: Jim Wyss
description: A Chinese hospital ship quietly docked in hurricane-hit Jamaica this week, projecting soft power into the heart of the Caribbean where a US armada is conducting a controversial anti-narcotics mission targeted at Venezuela.
title: Chinese Hospital Ship Visits Jamaica as US Gunboats Ply Caribbean

description: Elon Musk’s X social network was slapped with a lower-than-expected €120 million ($140 million) fine for violating the European Union’s controversial content-moderation law, in a move still set to raise tensions with the White House over free speech and tech regulation. Bloomberg's Tamlin Bason joins to discuss. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Musk’s X Fined €120 Million by EU in First Content-Law Penalty

author: Jenny Che
description: Shein, the online fast-fashion retailer, said the French government was overreaching in its attempt to suspend the platform by capitalizing on a political furor over sales of a childlike sex doll and weapons.
title: Shein Says France Suspension Case Is Political Overreach

author: Vinicius Andrade
description: Brazilian assets quickly slumped to session lows on Friday after a local media report that former President Jair Bolsonaro intends to back his son Flavio Bolsonaro in presidential elections next October.
title: Brazil Markets Drop on Report Bolsonaro to Back Son as Candidate

description: Federal spending is down slightly. Did Musk and DOGE do it? Bloomberg Opinion columnist Justin Fox looked at the data. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: How Much Credit Should DOGE Get?

author: Erik Wasson
description: Speaker Mike Johnson is pushing to unveil a Republican health care bill in the coming days for a vote by the end of the month, but the move is unlikely to resolve a congressional deadlock over expiring Obamacare subsidies.
title: Johnson Recycles GOP Health Ideas Amid Gridlock Over Obamacare

author: Kate Sullivan
description: Senior US and Chinese officials spoke about maintaining cooperation on trade, the latest sign of warming relations between the world’s two largest economies.
title: Top US, Chinese Officials Pledge Further Cooperation on Trade

description: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries, a Democrat from New York, says Republicans lied to the voters about trying to drive down "the high cost of living." Jeffries also says millions of Americans will see their healthcare costs go up because the GOP is not going to extend the Obamacare tax credits. He speaks to Bloomberg's Joe Mathieu. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Republicans Lied to Voters, Leader Jeffries Says

author: Kirsi Heikel
description: Finland, Sweden and Denmark shifted under NATO’s Norfolk command, streamlining Nordic defenses and allowing the alliance to better train how to defend the region.
title: Nordics Move Under NATO Norfolk Command to Boost Northern Defense

author: Michael J Kavanagh
description: The US is in talks to provide more than $1 billion for two critical minerals and railway projects in central Africa as it seeks to secure supplies deemed crucial for national security.
title: US Vows Over $1 Billion for Congo Critical Minerals Supply Chain

author: Konrad Krasuski, Zosia Wanat
description: Polish lawmakers failed to overturn a veto on a bill regulating digital assets, dealing a blow to Prime Minister Donald Tusk’s attempts to regulate a sector he says has been a conduit for Russia’s subterfuge in the European Union nation.
title: Polish Lawmakers Fail to Overturn Veto on Crypto Assets Bill

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: National Economic Council Director Kevin Hassett backed Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent’s call for a new residency requirement in the appointment of presidents of Federal Reserve banks.
title: Hassett Backs Call for Fed Presidents to Come From Districts

author: Francine Lacqua, Ewa Krukowska
description: President Donald Trump’s envoy to the European Union accused the bloc of unfairly targeting American tech giants moments before it penalized Elon Musk’s X social media network for violating a content law the White House hates.
title: US Ambassador Slams EU Tech Rules as Musk’s X Hit With Fine

author: Rajesh Kumar Singh, Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: India and Russia discussed expanding nuclear energy cooperation during President Vladimir Putin’s first official visit since the start of the war in Ukraine in 2022.
title: Modi, Putin Discuss a Second Russian Nuclear Plant in India

author: Ben Sills
description: The White House said Europe risks “civilizational erasure” as a result of decades of economic decline, political censorship and immigration, according to an annual national security update that amounts to another sharp Trump administration broadside against the continent.
title: Trump Says Europe Risks Being Wiped Away Unless It Changes

author: William Horobin
description: France’s National Assembly adopted the revenue part of the 2026 social security budget, easing doubts over Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu’s attempts to build compromise and stave off renewed political upheaval.
title: French Premier Lecornu Gets Win as Lawmakers Back Budget Measure

author: Julia Leite, Silvia Martinez
description: Argentina announced it will sell a local law bond in dollars, seizing on positive momentum after President Javier Milei’s resounding win in October’s congressional midterms.
title: Argentina to Sell Local Law Bond in Dollars Amid Milei Momentum

author: Arne Delfs, Michael Nienaber, Kamil Kowalcze
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz’s ruling coalition secured parliamentary backing for its contentious pension bill, avoiding a damaging setback that could have triggered the collapse of the government after only seven months in power.
title: Merz Averts Crisis With Approval for German Pension Bill

author: Andrea Palasciano
description: The US has given Europe until 2027 to take over the decisive bulk of NATO’s conventional defense capabilities, ranging from intelligence to missiles, Reuters reported on Friday, citing people it didn’t name.
title: US Gives Europe 2027 Deadline to Lead NATO Defense, Reuters Says

author: Mia Gindis
description: Lukoil North America, the US arm of sanctioned Russian oil giant Lukoil PJSC, is relying on two small New Jersey banks to keep its gas stations afloat after losing financing.
title: Lukoil’s US Arm Turns to Tiny Banks as Sanctions Roil Financing

author: Galit Altstein
description: The Israeli cabinet approved a 2026 budget aimed at maintaining high defense spending resulting from two years of conflict, while seeking to boost the strained economy via concessions to middle-class workers.
title: Israeli Cabinet Backs Budget Heavy on Defense Spending, Tax Cuts

author: Donato Paolo Mancini
description: Giorgia Meloni’s deputies are increasingly divided over whether Italy should continue sending aid to Ukraine as European leaders scramble to shore up financial and military support for Kyiv.
title: Meloni Government Rift Widens Over Continuing Aid to Ukraine

author: Gian Volpicelli, Samuel Stolton
description: Elon Musk’s X social network was slapped with a lower-than-expected €120 million ($140 million) fine for violating the European Union’s controversial content-moderation law, in a move still set to raise tensions with the White House over free speech and tech regulation.
title: Musk’s X Fined €120 Million by EU in First Content-Law Penalty

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump’s team is grappling with how to welcome the world for next year’s World Cup as he battles with countries — including co-hosts in Canada and Mexico — over his America First policies.
title: Trump’s World Cup Welcome Is Undercut by His Migrant Crackdown

author: Dan Strumpf
description: The Kremlin leader’s visit to New Delhi this week is as much about showmanship as substance.
title: Putin and Modi Deepen Their Trump-Defying Bromance

author: Ania Nussbaum
description: French President Emmanuel Macron said he’ll back a “European preference” for electric vehicles as Brussels draws up new proposals for the auto industry.
title: Macron Says He’ll Push for EU Preference for Electric Cars

author: John Bowker
description: Turkey plans to set up a facility in Pakistan to assemble combat drones, part of Ankara’s drive to boost its defense industry in international markets, according to Turkish officials familiar with the matter.
title: Turkey Plans Drone Facility in Pakistan in Global Defense Push

author: Flavia Krause-Jackson
description: Sleepy Oslo is bracing for the kind of impact unseen since Barack Obama rocked up to accept his unexpected Nobel Peace Prize. More than 15 years later, the trophy Donald Trump craves the most has been awarded to someone in deep hiding — who might just emerge to get it.
title: Nobel Winner Machado May Emerge From Hiding to Collect Prize, But It’s Risky

author: Slav Okov
description: Bulgaria’s opposition parties filed a no-confidence vote against the minority government of Prime Minister Rosen Zhelyazkov just weeks before the Balkan country is set to join the euro.
title: Bulgarian Government Faces No-Confidence Motion Amid Protests

author: Leah Nylen
description: Ninety years after the Supreme Court ruled on regulatory independence, the issue is again at stake.
title: The Ultimate Legal Fight Over Who Decides the Rules in America

author: Nacha Cattan
description: New York developers are transforming struggling office buildings into more than 12,000 new apartments in a bid to help offset the city’s worst housing crisis in decades.
title: NYC to Get 12,000 New Apartments From Outdated Office Buildings

author: Gonzalo Soto
description: Claudia Sheinbaum’s ability to steer Mexico through Donald Trump’s trade chaos turned her into an international phenomenon. A year into her presidency, however, she’s finding it harder to navigate political difficulties at home.
title: Sheinbaum Faces Next Trump Test While on Defense Back in Mexico

author: James Woolcock
description: The Financial Conduct Authority has told British lawmakers it is not investigating the release of information around Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’ budget, after opposition parties suggested it could have amounted to market abuse.
title: UK’s FCA Dismisses Calls for Market Abuse Inquiry Into Budget

description: Skylar Montgomery Koning, Guy Johnson and Anna Edwards break down today’s key themes for analysis and investors on “The Opening Trade.”  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Markets in 3 Minutes: Markets Dovishly Await Fed Amid Hassett

description:
Bloomberg Daybreak Europe is your essential morning viewing to stay ahead. Live from London, we set the agenda for your day, catching you up with overnight markets news from the US and Asia. And we'll tell you what matters for investors in Europe, giving you insight before trading begins.

Today's guests: Ellie Henderson, Economist at Investec & Tom Wehmeier, Partner at Atomico  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Warner Brothers, Netflix Potential Deal & Putin-Modi Meet | Daybreak Europe 12/5/2025

author: Jenny Leonard, Alberto Nardelli, Eric Martin, Ott Tammik
description: The US lobbied several countries in the European Union in an effort to block EU plans to use frozen Russian central bank assets to back a massive loan to Ukraine, according to European diplomats familiar with the matter.
title: US Urged Europeans to Oppose EU Plan for Loan to Support Ukraine

author: Eko Listiyorini, Chandra Asmara
description: Indonesian officials plan to take legal action against a dozen companies whose actions they say may have worsened deadly floods and landslides in northern Sumatra.
title: Indonesia Targets Companies as Floods Death Toll Surpasses 800

author: Tom Rees
description: UK house prices stalled ahead of the budget, according to data from one of the biggest mortgage lenders that suggested fears of tax rises had a dampening effect on the property market.
title: UK House Prices Stalled in November Amid Pre-Budget Caution

author: Beril Akman, Paul Wallace
description: A top US diplomat signaled that Turkey is getting closer to overcoming a key obstacle that has prevented it from purchasing American F-35 jets.
title: US Envoy Says Russia Hurdle for Turkish F-35 Quest to Be Cleared

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen, Dan Strumpf
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Russian President Vladimir Putin held a bilateral meeting in New Delhi, as the two leaders look to deepen economic cooperation in the face of pressure from US President Donald Trump.
title: Modi, Putin Meet to Deepen Economic Ties Despite US Pressure

description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz’s ruling coalition faces a key vote in parliament on a pension bill. A group of about 18 younger lawmakers from his own party has rebelled against the bill, which is due to go to a final ballot in the Bundestag at around 12:30 p.m. in Berlin. The move threatens to wipe out the coalition’s majority of just 12 seats and deal another blow to Merz’s credibility. Bloomberg’s Oliver Crook reports.
title: German Parliament to Vote on Key Pension Bill

author: Ania Nussbaum, Colum Murphy
description: France will receive a new pair of giant pandas in 2027, a display of Beijing’s panda diplomacy announced just as President Emmanuel Macron is in China to meet with his counterpart Xi Jinping.
title: France to Receive New Pandas from China After Macron-Xi Meeting

description: Salman Rushdie was nearly killed when he was stabbed 15 times on stage in New York in 2022. Releasing his first work of fiction since the attack, he speaks to Mishal Husain about free speech, the family connection they share and the places he’s called home, from India to the US.
title: Salman Rushdie: Free Speech Should Feel Uncomfortable

author: Arne Delfs
description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz’s ruling coalition with the Social Democrats faces a key vote in parliament on Friday that could precipitate its demise only seven months into its four-year term.
title: Merz’s Coalition on Edge Ahead of Crunch German Pension Vote

author: Sakura Murakami
description: Japan’s representative at the United Nations submitted a rebuttal against the latest Chinese letter to the UN, as the spat between the two nations over Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s comments on Taiwan continues to simmer.
title: Japan Rebuts China’s Second Letter to UN as Spat Keeps Simmering

description: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Former Secretary of Defense, Leon Panetta, states there are a lot of questions that need answering when weighing in on Secretary Pete Hegseth’s orders against a suspected drug-smuggling boat near Venezuela. Claudia Sahm, New Century Advisors Chief Economist, discusses what to expect during next week's Fed meeting. Mayor of St. Paul, Minnesota Melvin Carter (D) states the anxiety level is high in his community after President Trump announced he is planning to send immigration officers to the city to target Somali migrants. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Admiral at Center of Boat Strikes Briefs Lawmakers | Balance of Power: Late Edition 12/04/2025

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: A year after South Korea was shaken by its former leader’s disastrous attempt to impose martial law, President Lee Jae Myung has restored stability and is now using his popularity to press ahead with investor-friendly moves.
title: Lee Looks to Spur South Korea’s Markets a Year After Martial Law

author: Chris Strohm, Jimmy Jenkins
description: A federal grand jury in Virginia has refused to indict New York State Attorney General Letitia James for a second time over mortgage fraud claims.
title: Grand Jury Declines to Again Indict Letitia James in Fraud Case
